https://prez.dev/description.@value: An interdisciplinary academic field that integrates physical, biological and information sciences to the study of the environment, and the solution of environmental problems.
The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept

skos:exactMatch is used to link two concepts, indicating a high degree of confidence that the concepts can be used interchangeably across a wide range of information retrieval applications. skos:exactMatch is a transitive property, and is a sub-property of skos:closeMatch
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
Relates a concept to a concept that is more specific in meaning
A notation, also known as classification code, is a string of characters such as 'T58.5' or '303.4833' used to uniquely identify a concept within the scope of a given concept scheme
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
Relates a concept to the concept scheme that it is a top level concept of

https://prez.dev/label.@value: 1297.0 ANZSRC - Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification, 2020: Fields of Research (FoR)

https://prez.dev/description.@value: This division covers environmental sciences.

A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.
The study of the effect on humans (and life in general) of the distribution and interrelations of the chemical elements and radioactivity among surficial rocks, water, air, and biota.
Environmental resource management or environmental management is the management of the interaction and impact of human societies on the environment (and not the management of the environment itself).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: An interdisciplinary academic field that integrates physical, biological and information sciences to the study of the environment, and the solution of environmental problems. It specifically addresses: (1) social and political decision making and policy setting relative to the environment or environmental ethics, (2) the planning and management of natural and human resources with an emphasis on the social and political aspects, and (3) legal and regulatory aspects of environmental protection activities carried out by the government under its powers.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: From the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011) and Wikipedia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: An interdisciplinary academic field that integrates physical, biological and information sciences to the study of the environment, and the solution of environmental problems. It specifically addresses: (1) social and political decision making and policy setting relative to the environment or environmental ethics, (2) the planning and management of natural and human resources with an emphasis on the social and political aspects, and (3) legal and regulatory aspects of environmental protection activities carried out by the government under its powers.

The science dealing with soils as a natural resource on the surface of the Earth including (a) soil formation, soil classification and mapping; (b) physical, chemical, biological, and fertility properties of soils per se; and (c) these properties in relation to the use and management of soils.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc
